text:
Just a 5-minute walk from Kupang LRT, Sengkang Riverside Park turned out to be the perfect weekend escape. Lush greenery, calm waters, and the beautiful floating wetland made it feel like a quiet little world tucked right into the city.

The fruit-themed boardwalk and constructed wetlands were a nice surpriseâ€”spotted a few birds and dragonflies along the way too. Great place for a slow walk, a bit of reflection, or just a breather from the usual routine.

Grateful for spaces like this that offer peace so close to home.

A 'relatively' undiscovered gem of a little park (actually 2). Whilst not huge they are easy to walk around, one has a nice lake in the middle. Lots of wildlife to see. Quite accessible from Senkang sports centre. There are toilets, a water fountain and a restaurant, although this was closed when we went in the morning.
From amk ave 5 all the way with pcn to here. Along the way with river view. Not much people although in weekend. Quite a big park.
Enjoyed the greenery and view around this area. Nice area for walks with our furled, only thing to note is big red ants around the grass area
A wonderful park featuring a small pond, fruit trees native to Singapore, and a restaurant, making it an excellent spot for a family outing.
